metadata.Title: CVE-2016-9643 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
The regex code in Webkit 2.4.11 allows remote attackers to cause a denialof service (memory consumption) as demonstrated in a large number of ($(open parenthesis and dollar) followed by {-2,16} and a large number of +)(plus close parenthesis).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9643` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.16.1-1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.16.1-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.16.1-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.16.1-1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.16.1-1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37-gtk2 - 2.16.1-1
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.16.1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: webkit2gtk package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.16.1-1').
qtwebkit-opensource-src package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
